meanings.definition: To change the order or arrangement of
meanings.sent1: She permutes the books on her shelf to make them look neat.
meanings.sent2: The teacher permutes the seating plan every month to keep things fresh.
meanings.sent3: He permutes the ingredients in his recipe to create new flavors.
meanings.sent4: The artist permutes colors on the canvas to evoke different emotions.
meanings.sent5: The wind permutes the sand dunes, creating ever-changing patterns.

meanings.definition: To alter or transform in a systematic way
meanings.sent1: The scientist permutes the data to find new patterns.
meanings.sent2: Over time, the caterpillar permutes into a beautiful butterfly.
meanings.sent3: She permutes her daily routine to be more productive.
meanings.sent4: The magician permutes a simple card into a bouquet of flowers.
meanings.sent5: The potion permutes the frog into a prince in the fairy tale.
